title: Queenstown: Duo rob rub with samurai sword
text:
Two men wearing balaclavas are on the run after carjacking a man at knifepoint in Adelaide's northern suburbs overnight.

The incident occurred about 4am at Fremont Park in Elizabeth Vale, where the victim was sitting in his blue Ford sedan.

The offenders crashed the car 20 minutes later at the intersection of McIntyre Rd and Robert Rd in MacDonald Park.

Police Dog Nero searched the area, but was unable to sniff our the offenders.

Police say there is no evidence to suggest it is related to two armed hold-ups earlier in the night.

TWO MEN ROB PRINCE OF WALES HOTEL

Two hooded men, one who was armed with a small samurai sword, are on the run after holding up a pub in Adelaide's northwestern suburbs.

Police say the pair entered the Prince of Wales Hotel gaming room in Queenstown about 2.45am today and stole cash from the register.

One was reportedly armed with a small samurai sword, while the other was armed with a pole.

They were both wearing hoods and face coverings.

media_camera One of the men was armed with a small samurai sword, police say. File picture

ARMED PAIR HOLD UP SUSSEX HOTEL

Less than three hours earlier, a separate armed duo robbed the Sussex Hotel gaming room in Walkerville.

One was armed with a wheel brace, while the other had an iron bar.

They threatened staff and stole money from the cash register about 12.15am and are still on the run.

Police say they are investigating any possible links to the Queenstown robbery, but there is currently no clear relation.

Anyone with information on any of the above events that may assist the investigation is asked to contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000 or online.
description: Adelaide has been hit with a spate of armed theft overnight – two hold-ups at suburban pubs and a carjacking in the northern suburbs.
